content: <ce:section-title>Experimental</ce:section-title><ce:para view="all">[(C<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Sn]Cl, SeO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> and ethanol were all purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification. [(<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>-C<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N]VO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> was prepared according to the literature method . SeO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (42<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.38<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and [(<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>-C<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>N]VO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> (125<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.38<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) were dissolved together in 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL of dehydrated ethanol and stirred for 2<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. Then, the solution of [(C<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Sn]Cl (146<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mg, 0.38<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) in 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL of dehydrated ethanol was added slowly. After the mixture had been stirred for about 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h, the filtrate was kept undisturbed for 2 days. Colorless transparent block crystals of compound <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> were isolated in about 27% yield (based on [(C<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>Sn]Cl). Anal. Calcd. (%) for Ph<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>SnO<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>SeC<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>O: C, 42.72; H, 3.98; Found (%): C, 42.65; H, 3.92. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup>): 1008 (s, C<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>C<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O), 886 (s, C<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>Se), 779 (vs, Se<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O), 638 and 661 (m, Sn<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>Sn), 482 (m, Sn<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>O).</ce:para>
clean_text:
Experimental

[(C6H5)3Sn]Cl, SeO2 and ethanol were all purchased from commercial sources and used without further purification. [(n-C4H9)4N]VO3 was prepared according to the literature method . SeO2 (42mg, 0.38mmol) and [(n-C4H9)4N]VO3 (125mg, 0.38mmol) were dissolved together in 5mL of dehydrated ethanol and stirred for 2h. Then, the solution of [(C6H5)3Sn]Cl (146mg, 0.38mmol) in 3mL of dehydrated ethanol was added slowly. After the mixture had been stirred for about 1h, the filtrate was kept undisturbed for 2 days. Colorless transparent block crystals of compound 1 were isolated in about 27% yield (based on [(C6H5)3Sn]Cl). Anal. Calcd. (%) for Ph3SnO2SeC2H5O: C, 42.72; H, 3.98; Found (%): C, 42.65; H, 3.92. Selected IR data (KBr pellet, cm-1): 1008 (s, CCO), 886 (s, COSe), 779 (vs, SeO), 638 and 661 (m, SnOSn), 482 (m, SnO).
